result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna Shanice Futch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brianna Shanice Futch appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Brianna Shanice Futch.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for DPA Hearing.  Defense counsel is not ready to proceed with DPA Hearing at this time and requests adjourned date.  Case adjourned, Br.41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court orally orders no contact order with CRB.  Court will allow third party contact for the purpose of childcare.

Defendant Brianna Shanice Futch appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Brianna Shanice Futch.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Court orally orders no contact order with CRB.  Court will allow third party contact for the purpose of childcare.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brianna Shanice Futch in court. Student Intern Lucas Jaeger under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brianna Shanice Futch
Current: 7626 W Congress St., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 06-26-2022)
Prior: 402 South 60th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53214
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/6/22 @ 2p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 08-01-2022 @ 1pm.
